courseInfo.branch: Electronics and Communication Engineering / Information and Communication Technology
courseInfo.prerequisite: Basic knowledge of electronic circuits, signal and EM wave
courseInfo.departmentName: Electronics and Communication Engineering / Information and Communication Technology

rationale: Students of diploma Electronics and Communication Engineering need to have a thorough understanding of fundamental concepts of Communication Engineering. Diploma students undertaking this course are expected to apply the fundamentals of basic electronic communication system to analyze the different communication (Modulation and Demodulation) methods with its techniques, various antenna for specific application this basic course develop skills required to learn communication to meet the expectations of the industry.

courseOutcomes.description: Distinguish various signals and noise in communication system.
Understand sampling theory and waveforms coding techniques
Use relevant type of antenna for various applications.

content: Electromagnetic (EM) wave spectrum, frequency bands and their applications domain
Signals and its representation: analog and digital Signal, Pulse, Impulse, Saw-tooth, sinusoidal and rectangular (In Time & frequency domain)
Block diagram of Analog and Digital communication system
Modulation: Definition & its classification based on analog & pulse signal as carrier
Noise in communication system, classification of noise, signal to noise ratio(S/N) and noise figure
Need of modulation

Types of modulation techniques, Amplitude Modulation: Modulating signal, Carrier signal, modulation Index, mathematical representation of AM Signal, representation in time and frequency domain, Frequency Spectrum, Types of AM band spectrum (DSB, SSB) and their applications, Power relations in AM wave, bandwidth, Power saving in SSB
Generation of AM: DSBSC signal using balanced modulator circuit
Demodulation of AM signal: Envelope detector using diode
Block diagram and working of each block of super heterodyne receiver with waveforms Characteristics Selectivity, Sensitivity, Image frequency rejection and Fidelity

Frequency modulation: Mathematical representation of FM signal Use of Bessel's function (no derivation), representation of FM signal in time domain and frequency domain, frequency deviation ratio, modulation index (numerical), types of frequency modulation (Narrow Band and Wide Band FM)
Phase Modulation: definition, waveforms and applications
Pre-emphasis and De-emphasis
Generation techniques for FM wave: Phase locked loop FM modulator
Basics and types of FM demodulators: Ratio detector and PLL as FM demodulator
FM Receiver: Block diagram and working with waveforms
Compare AM, FM and PM
Statement and proof of sampling theorem
Nyquist rate and interval
Aliasing error, under sampling, over sampling and critical sampling
Ideal, Natural and flat top sampling
Pulse Modulation techniques: PAM, PWM, PPM
Concept of Quantization
Classification of quantization
PCM transmitter and receiver
Properties of EM (electromagnetic) wave
Antenna fundamentals: Resonant antenna and Nonresonant antennas, ideal antenna, principle of transmitting and receiving antenna
Antenna parameters: Radiation pattern, polarization, bandwidth, beam width, antenna resistance, directivity and power gain, antenna gain
Dipole antenna and radiation pattern and Radiation Pattern for Unidirectional, bidirectional and Omni directional antenna
Antenna (working principle, construction, radiation pattern and applications): Loop antenna, folded dipole, Yagi-Uda antenna and smart antenna

practicalOutcomes.outcome: Measure amplitude of different sinusoidal frequency signals in frequency domain using Spectrum Analyzer
To study about basic block diagram of communication system and list various communication channel
To generate amplitude modulation (AM) and to measure modulation index of AM
Measure modulation index of an AM envelope by trapezoidal Method
To perform AM modulation and AM demodulation using trainers/simulation
Locate various sections of AM radio receiver trainer kit and draw the waveforms at input and output side of each section
To perform FM modulation and FM demodulation using trainers/simulation
Obtain the frequency response of Pre-emphasis and De-emphasis circuit
Determine Modulation Index of Frequency Modulated wave
Demonstration of fault finding of AM or FM radio receivers
Based on the sampling frequency, reconstruct the signal
Check the performance of PAM system
Check the performance of PWM system
Check the performance of PPM system
Check the performance PCM system for various sinusoidal Signals
To plot the radiation pattern of an Omni-directional antenna (Polar plot on log/linear scales & Cartesian plot on log/linear scales)
Check radiation pattern of folded dipole antenna
